page.title: 02BUCKINGHAM COMMUNITY CENTRE.
page.content: The Buckingham Community Centre is one of the town's newest buildings,having been completed in 1984. In a special survey,4 out of the 9 people questioned did attend the Community Centre. Those who did not said that they did not live locally, or that they were new to the area, or that they did not know what was happening there. The Centre is used as a children's surgery,coffee morning centre,playhouse,'Seesaw Club' meeting place,University Examination centre and general 'Village Hall' for wedding receptions etc. 3 people thought that it could offer more,whilst the other 6 were quite satisfied and thought it was a good idea. All 9 people thought that it had been built in the best possible place.
